name: ChaseTheChuckwagon.com
overview:
ChaseTheChuckwagon.com, named for a very rare Atari 2600 game considered by most collectors to be the first “holy grail” of video game collecting, was launched on March 24, 2008 to be a less expensive auction alternative dedicated to classic and modern gaming.

Since then the site has grown to nearly 2,300 members (now registering nearly 200 new members per month), hosted over 100,000 auctions and sold over $90,000 in merchandise; making ChaseTheChuckwagon.com the most successful video gaming auction site to date.

Featuring no listing fee auctions combined with inexpensive selling/final value fees and a variety of free listing promotional tools, ChaseTheChuckwagon.com has taken the familiar auction environment so successfully pioneered by Ebay and reduced the costs to sell.

Rounding out the auction site is a newly launched, but thriving forum community where members can get to know one another.

acquisitions.source_description: Leading video game auction site acquires struggling competitor
